Class PhysicsVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • PhysicsVector

  • public class PhysicsVector
extends java.lang.Object
    A 3-dimensional vector class to be used in the development of computer simulations of various physical systems. The 3-dimensional vector represents a standard cartesian vector given by xi + yj +zk where i, j, and k are unit vectors in the x, y, and z direction respectiveley.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Iain A. Bertram

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhysicsVector()
      Default contructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude
      PhysicsVector(double[] x)
      Contructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array.
      PhysicsVector(double x, double y)
      Contructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction, the second argument y giving the component in the j direction, the z component is set to zero.
      PhysicsVector(double x, double y, double z) 
      PhysicsVector(PhysicsVector v)
      Constructor that creates a vector with same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector()
        Default contructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(double x,
                     double y)
        Contructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction, the second argument y giving the component in the j direction, the z component is set to zero.

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z)

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(double[] x)
        Contructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array. If array length 2 it sets the x and y components. Returns a default vector if the array is not length 2 or 3 and prints a warning message.

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector(PhysicsVector v)
        Constructor that creates a vector with same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.

        Method to return a String which represents the vector and has the form x y z (I.e. only seperated by spaces).
        Returns:
        String "x y z"

      • print2D

        public void print2D()
        prints the vector to standard out using the System.out.println command. Note: it will include a carriage return. Prints: xi + yj

      • print

        public void print()
        prints the vector to standard out using the System.out.println command. Note: it will include a carriage return. Prints: xi + yj + zk

      • formatString

        public java.lang.String formatString()
        Method to return a formatted String which represents the vector and has the form x y z (I.e. only seperated by spaces).
        Returns:
        String "x y z"

        y - y-component of the vector

      • setVector

        public void setVector(double x,
                      double y)
        Change the value of the vector to xi + yj. The z-component is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        x - x-component of the vector
        y - y-component of the vector

      • setVector

        public void setVector(PhysicsVector v)
        Modify the vector so that it is equal to vector v
        Parameters:
        v - the vector that the used to set the values of the modified vector.

      • increaseBy

        public void increaseBy(PhysicsVector v)
        Add a vector v to the original vector. Normal vector addition is carried out. I.e. the x-components are added and the y components are added.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to be added to original vector.

      • decreaseBy

        public void decreaseBy(PhysicsVector v)
        Subtract a vector v from the original vector.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to be subtracted from original vector.

      • magnitude

        public double magnitude()
        returns the magnitude of the vector. If the vector is given by xi +yj +zk Then the magnitude is Math.sqrt(x*x + y*y + zz)
        Returns:
        a scalar with the magnitude

      • getUnitVector

        public PhysicsVector getUnitVector()
        returns a vector with magnitude of one and the original direction of the original vector. I.e. scale the vector by 1/magnitude. If vector is a zero vector then returns zero length vector
        Returns:
        unit vector with direction of original vector

      • scale

        public void scale(double x)
        scale the components of the vector by the scalar. I.e. If the scalar is s then the vector transfoms to s*xComponent i + s*yComponent j.
        Parameters:
        x - the factor to scale the vector by.

      • scale

        public static PhysicsVector scale(double x,
                                  PhysicsVector v)
        static scale the components of the vector by the scalar. I.e. If the scalar is s then the vector transfoms to s*xComponent i + s*yComponent j.
        Parameters:
        x - the factor to scale the vector by.
        v - the vector to scale

      • dot

        public static double dot(PhysicsVector v,
                         PhysicsVector u)
        dot is a standard vector scalar product. E.g. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the dot product returns xw + yz
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in product
        u - second vector in product
        Returns:
        return scalar product

      • cross

        public static PhysicsVector cross(PhysicsVector v,
                                  PhysicsVector u)
        cross performs a standard vector cross product.
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in product
        u - second vector in product
        Returns:
        return cross product

      • add

        public static PhysicsVector add(PhysicsVector v,
                                PhysicsVector u)
        standard vector addition. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the addition returns a vector (x+w)i + (y+z)j
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in sum
        u - second vector in sum
        Returns:
        return summed vector

      • subtract

        public static PhysicsVector subtract(PhysicsVector v,
                                     PhysicsVector u)
        vector subtraction. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the subtraction method returns a vector (x-w)i + (y-z)j
        Parameters:
        v - first vector
        u - vector to subtract from first vector
        Returns:
        return v-u vector

      • multiply

        public static PhysicsVector multiply(PhysicsVector v,
                                     PhysicsVector u)
        component by component multiplication of two vectors. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the multiplication method returns a vector (x*w)i + (y*z)j
        Parameters:
        v - first vector
        u - vector to 'multiply' by first vector
        Returns:
        return v_i*u_i vector

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(PhysicsVector v,
                             PhysicsVector u)
        returns true if the vector components have equal length to within 1-34 (chosen since exact equivalence for doubles is difficult to obtain exact equivalence. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then return true if abs(x-w) < 1-34 and abs(y-z) < 1-34
        Parameters:
        v - first vector
        u - second vector
        Returns:
        return true if vectors are sufficiently equal

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector and has the form xi + yj +zk.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String xi + yj + zk
